intro: Gossia virotii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gossia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Gossia virotii is often found in shaded understorey environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
